intro: Cherleria octandra, commonly known as the African cherry tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, clustered white or yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. It is also valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts used in traditional medicine to treat ailments such as fever and inflammation. Cherleria octandra thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats.
